issue.title: pyteomics 3.4 incompatible with current versions of pepxmltk and cythonize

content.raw:
Thanks for reporting. I'm not used to conda and couldn't make your first command work right off the bat, but I see that if I `conda install pyteomics` and then `pip install pyteomics.pepxmltk`, it breaks pyteomics imports.

This happens because `pyteomics` is installed as an egg: `some_env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyteomics-3.4-py2.7.egg`, and `pyteomics.pepxmltk` installs into `some_env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyteomics`. Apparently the import mechanism then ignores the egg when looking for modules.
content.html:
Thanks for reporting. I'm not used to conda and couldn't make your first command work right off the bat, but I see that if I conda install pyteomics and then pip install pyteomics.pepxmltk, it breaks pyteomics imports.

This happens because pyteomics is installed as an egg: some_env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyteomics-3.4-py2.7.egg, and pyteomics.pepxmltk installs into some_env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyteomics. Apparently the import mechanism then ignores the egg when looking for modules.

issue.title: pyteomics 3.4 incompatible with current versions of pepxmltk and cythonize

content.raw: Thanks for looking into it. I've reported the issues on the bioconda-recipes github (including what you found about the `egg` vs `pyteomics` folder), since the issue only appear to be with installation through conda.
content.html: Thanks for looking into it. I've reported the issues on the bioconda-recipes github (including what you found about the egg vs pyteomics folder), since the issue only appear to be with installation through conda.

issue.title: pyteomics 3.4 incompatible with current versions of pepxmltk and cythonize

content.raw: Closing as this has been [fixed on the bioconda side](https://github.com/bioconda/bioconda-recipes/issues/8971).
content.html: Closing as this has been fixed on the bioconda side.
